divs: Sighting DetailsTaking photographs to the sunset, in a place that is clear of buildings to the West, (ihave been there may times, just 10 minutes from home) I discovered what I thought it was a bird at first, when isaw it in the second of a series of over 100 pictures, when reviewing them next day. I didn't see personally the object. I took this picture because of the bright green contrast and grey and brown colors. I thought it was nice. I am also a painter and I like to take color samples from Nature (see my page www.littlenova.net) I am also an active glider pilot since 1991.I know local birds (mostly sparrows and blackbirds, some doves and storks in the cities). & miles from the spot is Torrejon AF base. 13 miles away is Madrid Barajas airport Mi coordinates while taking the picture: N40��� 33' 10" W3��� 20' 26" The object was on vector 275��� from my position. I estimate a distance of half a mile to one mile, to the object. The sun was on direction approx 245��� Time: 17:39 Temp. +3��� C Wind North 5 knots The camera is Olympus 500UZ, 6MP, x10 zoom. The picture was taken with maximum zoom (x10), automatic foucs and settings.
Summary: Discovered the image when reviewing pictures taken the day before
trends: There have been no other sightings in Meco
This sighting has been favorited 1 time.
